name: Language
body:
### The Last of the Phoenicians
Many writing systems that we use today descended directly from the "first alphabet", which was far superior to the nonsense that exists today. The letters looked like their name.
* alf
* bet
* gaml
* delt
* he
* wau
* zai
* het
* tet
* yod
* kaf
* lamd
* mem
* nun
* semk
* ain
* pe
* sade
* qof
* rosh
* shin
* tau

Other useful Information about our language:
* Phnx, 115
* http://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/U10900.pdf
* Unicode Range 10900-1091F 

* Numbers: one, ten, twenty, one-hundred, two, three
* Punctuation: word-separator

![Phoenix "Coyotes"](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/10/PHXold.svg/200px-PHXold.svg.png)

### Support or Contact
If you are having difficulty with Unicode in your computer programs, contact language@data.io and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
